website_summaries.verdict: Uses an aluminum alloy that allows it to remain lightweight.
pros: Reasonable price point for a bike cargo rack, and it also ships with a free cargo net
Will fit most types of bicycles
Easy to install and remove from the bike with a quick release mount
cons: Likely won't live up to claim of carrying 115-pound loads

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I can finally go grocery shopping on my bike. The installation was super easy. Only took me about 30 minutes to install. It’s good that they included some shorter screws because of the size of my bike, I had to switch them around so they won’t interfere with the spoke.
customer_reviews.author: klee

customer_reviews.title: Works for my commute
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a rack for my work commute on an older carbon fiber road frame that I have (which doesn't have mounting points on the chainstays). The plan was to add panniers to the rack for the things I need to bring to work, ~15 miles each way. This rack was fairly easy to install, and feels extremely secure with the seatpost mount and chainstay braces. I added about 15lbs in the panniers snapped onto this rack, and it feels 100% solid. No problems at all during my ride.
customer_reviews.author: R2P2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great rack! I installed this on my carbon fiber frame road bike, and it adds minute weight! I use this rack daily on my commute to work. I attached 2 lightweight removable side carriers, and and it added very minimal weight! I have used this rack for 3 months , and I love it! Easy to install! My 15 year old son installed the rack for me without any problems! I recommend this rack , and am planning on purchasing another one to put on another carbon fiber frame road bike!
customer_reviews.author: nmiller

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack for teenage son's Specialized bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack for teenage son's Specialized bike. Easy to install. Sturdy, lightweight and affordable when compared to similar racks. Arrived well packaged with all parts. The bike rack is very good- but the seller, Dirza, is great. When they discovered my initial purchase did not arrive, Dirza quickly responded and made it right even though the item was packaged and shipped by Amazon. Would buy from Dirza again with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials all accessories included
customer_reviews.text: Quality material. Lots of connection points that may get loose over time but quality construction and good for Light to moderate use. Came with instructions, Allen wrench, crescent wrench And reflector. 15 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Paesan

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Solid bike rack. 30min to install. It seems sturdy, and works great for road bike frames that don't have dropout eyelets. I give four stars only because the brackets for the lower attachment aren't compatible with slim seat stays (rear frame). I simply folded the rubber pieces inside the brackets (see pic) to make it work, but now you know. I would purchase again, though. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Very solid construction. clever design to fit a variety ...
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction. clever design to fit a variety of bike configurations. Got to have enough seat post exposed to allow attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn E O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the time and money in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I received the package in the rather large box it was well-protected and very easy to assemble and I got it at a very timely manner definitely would recommend using this company in the future two friends and family
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles around and won't work with ROS bags
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought this would be more stable than other racks for mountain bikes but it really isn't. Even with every bolt and nut tightened and the rubber parts to add pressure it still jiggles around. I'd trust it with a small 3-5 pound bag but anything heavier and it'll bend the rack out of the shape on a sharp turn or hard bump. The other major downside is the short 'bars' on the sides, as it won't allow most pannier bags to sit correctly without sliding around or hitting the wheels. So if you normally use the ROS bag set, it won't be secure. Bit of a shame as I liked the design, but I don't entirely trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Will fit on a Mongoose Dolomite!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a rack to fit my Dolomite and this one looked like it would. It took me around a half hour to install. Seems pretty sturdy, however, there are a lot of screws on this, so maybe make checking the tightness a part of your maintenance routine. One thing that I would have liked, the reflector mount is pretty cheap and cheesy. I rigged up a way to mount my taillight, but, something better could have been done. Otherwise, it’s quiet with no rattling around. It’s very light. And its pretty unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Too many issues.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up getting this to work and I will keep it, but I had a couple of serious issues. First off, the quick release lever itself is very cheap feeling and all the paint on it rubbed off almost immediately. Fortunately it's a standard screw size (M6) and I didn't need the quick release feature so I just replaced the lever with a screw. Second the reflector mount on the end is super cheap looking and riveted on. I wanted to mount a bike lights where the mount was but ended up needed a dremel and some creative work. Although in the end everything feels solid and the rack works, I wouldn't order this again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Great cargo rack
customer_reviews.text: Even from opening the shipped package, one could tell that it was organized well. I personally did not care for the colored assembly instructions but would have chosen a B/W schematic instead. This product was very easy to assemble and really is "light as a feather" Did not have any problems with the assembly process and liked the way that the frame also doubled as a "wrench" when tightening the locknuts. Thanks for a well thought out carrier.
customer_reviews.author: SherpaDaddy1989

customer_reviews.title: Screws rusted in two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Uhh what can I say. It's an "ok" rack overall. Very light. Putting it on is.. challenging. Being connected to your seat post makes it impossible to put your bike in a stand by the seat post, and of course you can't move your seat easily if you wanted to. My biggest issue was the screws rusted immediately. The bike and rack are indoors, but there is a lot of humidity present here. Instead of waiting for them to seize up, I ended up returning the rack instead. Maybe this is different in dry climates, I can't say. The price was certainly great, and the rack it self was sturdy enough for a small bag.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaJim Z99

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the rear to install!
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain in the rear to assemble and install!!! The instructions were horrible and didn’t clearly explain what to do. We ended up with an extra part (bungee, not the net) because we never saw when and how to install it. We finally installed the rack on my daughter’s bike, but it still seems a tad wobbly. If you want to get frustrated and you have lots of time to do so, then you won’t mind this rack. Otherwise, don’t order it. Choose something else.
customer_reviews.author: Soprano

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. Poor quality. Poor construction. The shelf portion was not square with the part that attaches to the seat tube. The silver colored reflector clip was loose and rattled. Could find no way to mount normal rear bike lights. Upright supports interfered with the rear gear changing wire. I drilled holes to try to mount a rear light before I realized all of the problems mounting this thing, got mad and threw it away, so there's nothing left to return. Too bad, so sad!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Winkel

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for a ladies bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike rack for a ladies’ road bike, I’m 5’5’’, and I had to raise the seat so high that I could no longer reach the pedals in order to install. In addition this bike rack was extremely challenging to install, even for my husband who would not typically have any difficulty with something like this. Pay an additional $15-$20 to get something of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: kristin

customer_reviews.title: Did not secure well
customer_reviews.text: I believe company is sometimes sending wrong bolts or nuts. Search reviews for the word "bolts" as I just did, and you will see that some others had the same issue as me. Side bars could not secure tightly. This was NOT due to me having an incompatible bike. Some pieces fell off as I was riding. But I probably shouldn't have even tried riding anyway, since the side bars were just too loose. (Also, install instructions are not the best, but you can figure it out.) Returning product.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, Sturdy and Stylish Too
customer_reviews.text: This rack attaches to the seat post so you can adjust the height. I purchased side bags too so the side arm supports are a great plus; no worry about the bags getting in the spokes. Adjustable arms give strength and seem to fit where you want them. Great value with a strap down and cargo net thrown in. Looks good. One caution: the clamps that you attach the arms to must allow for a cable to pass through or by. I found that by bending the support arm slightly my cable works just fine. Most applications probably won't need any modification.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Collins

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy rack
customer_reviews.text: You never know what you will get, when buying online. This rack is substantial. It is sturdy. It is made extremely well. It is quite easy to install as well. If you know what you are doing and understand how it is to be installed, it will be the strongest rack you will ever buy for the price. Installed incorrectly and yes, it will be flimsy. Understand mechanics and how the leverage of the bars are used will help you install this rack properly and it will give you many years of use. Guaranteed! Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: The Munchkin

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by this purchase. I really wasn't sure what to expect but, after installing it (only took about 10 mins) I was happy to find that it was pretty darn sturdy. I've had it on my bike for a few weeks now and it hasn't loosened at all. It appears to be pretty versatile, as far as what you can mount it on. It has adjustable parts that made it easy to fit my bike just right. The net that came with it is really cheesy though. It started fraying after the first time I stretched it over a grocery bag. Tossed it and just use small bungees now. All in all, this was solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great balance between strength versus weight of rack.
customer_reviews.text: Quality rack. Came with wrench and Allen wrench. This unit appears to be well made yet not very heavy. Easy install however, I placed this on my 50 year old WT Grants Aquarius 10 10 speed and the rubber shims that are placed in the clamps were not thick enough. All the tubing is 1 inch and the frame wheel braces are smaller as it is steel. Luckily, Lowes sells 6 by 6 inch rubber sheets for custom plumbing washers and I cut extra shims out of it, worked like a charm. Also came with stretch netting to secure items. Very happy with purchase and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel "God is my judge"

customer_reviews.title: Very light in weight but very sturdy and strong. No flexing! Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I was only expecting a product in this price range (good) to get by with for now, but it is so much more than that! It is surprisingly light to the touch, but very tight and strong. You could not twist this without some other kind of tool or lever. I did not believe the photo of a person standing on this rack, I thought "Yeah Right!" but this is so sturdy that you could put that much weight on it easily - but why? This will outlast my bike!! They include a flexible strap too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Caruso

customer_reviews.title: We'll have to test!
customer_reviews.text: My bike guy was a little loath to install this rack on my new carbon-frame Diverge (from Specialized). But I really want to try taking it on my next Great Lake ride (which will last about 1 month), so panniers and a trunk are necessary. He's cautioned me to keep the weight on this rack LIGHT, but for the moment it SEEMS like it will work. I'll distribute the weight of what I take to my camelback and frame pack...so it's NOT on the rack. And I'll check back in and report how it all "went down", hopefully not literally.
customer_reviews.author: K. Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: I had high expectations,  smh
customer_reviews.text: I had to improvise into making it work, horrible welding. Probably bought it for $5 each in bulk and sells it for 30. Needs to explain that it will not fit in a fixie. All the clamps are too wide for the seat post that it will not lock unless I loosen it to the point where the seat rotates. Very cheap quality and I wouldn't rely this on food delivery tasks as it can be unreliable. However flipping the w-bars may work on holding cargo if they do not wish to purchase pannier bags.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy and secure
customer_reviews.text: Happy with my purchase. Wasn't sure what to expect at this price point, but I'm very satisfied. Wish I would have purchased a rack sooner. It is very sturdy and secure. Cargo net included is nice. Took about 30 minutes to install. Instructions were clear and easy to follow. Only issue I had with the install was not installing the reflector on before adjusting the length of the top portion. Because I had it fully extended, you could not install the reflector when instructed to do so in the instructions. Was able to remove a few screws instead of fully taking apart. Would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S - MN

customer_reviews.title: Cheap metal, used product
customer_reviews.text: The product is a light, cheap metal. If you over tighten the screws it will literally go through the metal and make a hole, that is how thin the metal is. However, it does seem sturdy enough once assembled on the bike. My product seems to have come “used” which is why I gave it the 2/5 stars. This is evident in the fact that the black paint was chipped and scratched in a couple of places. If it weren’t for the fact that I’ve been suffering from bad back aches due to carrying my heavy back pack while I ride, I would have returned it. Also, it did not come with enough washers for the screws.
customer_reviews.author: RZ

customer_reviews.title: Works on Giant Liv Flourish bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Liv Flourish Hybrid bike. You need at least 3-4" of seat post exposed you can install this rack. You don't have to use the side pannier holders- we didn't. The hardware seams sturdy- not sure yet if they are actually stainless. For the price which was much less than the bike shop, it seems well made and suits our needs. We have attached a wire basket to the rack with zip ties so that we can put groceries etc in it. The mesh cover fits well.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: it seemed like it would have been acceptably stable
customer_reviews.text: This didn't fit either of our bikes. It requires the saddle to be raised fairly high; clearance is needed for the the front of the rack to fit under the saddle and clamp to the saddle post. While I didn't get to use the rack, it seemed like it would have been acceptably stable, and it came with a hex key and a little wrench, so you shouldn't need additional tools to install the rack. If you have a large amount of saddle post exposed, this rack may fit your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Shagott

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient
customer_reviews.text: This rack may hold heavy weight, but it is inconvenient to install & uninstall as situation calls for it. 1. Two support arm clamps need tool to install and uninstall. And the process becomes inconvenient as it's done often. 2. Side racks are too small to secure pannier bags from bouncing and swinging. 3. Rubber pads on clamps are not reliable. I lost some of the rubber pads as I installed and removed the rack, so I wrapped old tire tube around the frame as substitute pads.
customer_reviews.author: Hyun Park

customer_reviews.title: Arms didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: The install went easily for the portion that attached to the bike seat (even if it did scratch up both the rack and my bike seat a bit). When I tried to attach the stabilizing arms, they were far too large to do their job. You could DIY it, but I don't know how and it seems like a waste of time and money to me. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Crap quality and impossible installation
customer_reviews.text: Absolute crap product. Nothing fits, need fillers at all connections. Have the guts to tell the consumer in the manual to use "waste bike inner tires" to fill up the connections! Who on earth has waste bikes readily available to then cut out pieces of old tires for this. How about providing some extra rubber to begin with?! Nuts are far too tight for the bolts. And tools are inadequate to compensate for nut tightness. A complete failure.
customer_reviews.author: Bas den Braber

customer_reviews.title: Functions as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The rear bike rack works as advertised and was easy to install. The only reason for 4 stars is that the bag I am using is larger and when it has lots of weight, the bottom corners of the bag curl in and rub a little on the spokes of the wheel. But again that may be the issue of the bag. These do hold a lot of weight, fit various bike styles (road bike and mountain bike), and are easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Albert E.

customer_reviews.title: Not "universal" at all.
customer_reviews.text: It says it's universal, but it fits none of my 3 bikes. Luckily I had spare parts left and was able to manage a seat post fit. Then I realized that this rack will not work on a suspension bike, and by installing it you make it a rigid tail. Not sure if I even want to keep this. Taking it to the local bike shop to see if it can be made right, if not then back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Cussomerz

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine, needs better instructions
customer_reviews.text: Just rec'd and installed the cargo rack. Tools were included which was nice. I'm still not sure that I've got it installed in the "approved" manner but it looks good and seems sturdy. The instructions nor the diagrams are very clear on which direction the clamps on the down struts should be mounted, whether inside or out. I installed the first one out, and then had to go back and change it once I installed the other side. Overall I think that I'll be quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: James L Beam

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, moves around and comes loose
customer_reviews.text: The rack was flimsy and unstable. Rattled constantly and I didn't trust it to actually hold my stuff. I would return it but I had to take it off In the middle of the night while riding and lost pieces. No matter how tight I made the screws, it still jiggled. The rack itself rattled constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: If you value your time then don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't call it a CCPoS but it's definitely Chinese, parts machined incorrectly or they sent the wrong piece, that sort of thing. Looks simple to install but it's not - multiple pieces and will take 30-90 minutes regardless of your tools or experience. Bolt attachments behind the seat stem catch your shorts while riding (unless you wear tights) and will eventually tear them. This thing was designed to sell cheap on Amazon and I would pass.
customer_reviews.author: Craig W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product and real customer service!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike rack as is decently sturdy. It came with printed directions, which were okay, but seemed to be translated, so some of the phrasing was a bit disjointed. Big pro: I had trouble with the included nuts because I was unfamiliar with how locking nuts work. I contacted the company via the Amazon seller contact area and within a couple hours they responded with the answer. (You have to use the included wrench to tighten the nut) 5 STARS FOR ACTUALLY BEING ABLE TO CONTACT THE COMPANY AND GET REAL HELP! THANK YOU!!! I have now used my rack several times and really enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine product
customer_reviews.text: This is so well designed -so light -and sturdy- and so cleaver that I really don't know how they do it at such a low price. The directions for installation could be better but there is a video on YOU TUBE that is VERY good--watch it first and all will be well. You do need 2 inches under your saddle.And you can't install a" bouncer "under the saddle.
customer_reviews.author: L&J

customer_reviews.title: Pretty meh about this.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, upon assembly, the included short screws are too long and leave the W bars and mounts rattling, which is nothing you want to have to listen to on a bike ride. The ad also says a cargo net is included, but nothing was in the package. Installs easily enough, but just know it's going to be a noisy ride whenever you use it. Not a single screw fastens tight.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine A.

customer_reviews.title: Quick release seat post attachment! Very strong rack!
customer_reviews.text: The overall design is very substantial and a good powder coated finish. I needed a rear rack that attaches to the seat post as I’m installing it on an older Specialized “S” works mtn bike that does not have all of the little threaded frame bosses as more of a commuter bike has. The design with the bungee cords & ability to slide the rack forward & backward is also a great feature. “Great product especially for the price”
customer_reviews.author: Gary Albertson

customer_reviews.title: Dirza Rear Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this on my bike. Was fairly easy to install. The wrench they included to hold the nut wasn’t the best but does the job. If you have your own I would use it to make holding the nut easier. Seems very sturdy and while it claims to hold 115lbs I won’t be holding anything near that weight on rack. My wife likes it so I may order another one for her bike.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack!
customer_reviews.text: As a rule I don't like bike racks, they always look odd - BUT - since moving to a beach town and having to haul beach stuff on my beach cruiser a rack became a necessity. This was easy to install, it is strong and I have had zero problems with it. I have hauled coolers full of ice and beverages on it. I didn't install the side bars and the way it mounts you can remove the whole rack in 5 minutes if you don't want to look like PeeWee Herman.
customer_reviews.author: John Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t reccommend for anyone serious
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were written in bad English, my panniers don’t mount to this well, and there is no way this thing would hold 100lbs like advertised. I would just spend a little extra and get one at REI
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mumma

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This product comes with everything. Most of the hardware is assembled. The bonus cargo net is heavy duty. The rack has a sticker that says weight limit is 220 lbs. Factoring in a rough ride, it should be around 120 lb. When installed, the rack does not flex. It arrives packed in several plastic bags, and mine had a few paint scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Cimmay

customer_reviews.title: it will not fit no matter what you do
customer_reviews.text: Im sorry I hate to give a bad review but this rack does NOT fit on a bike seat pole .. its way to big .. you tighten it all the way and try and clamp it and its still slides all around .. you put rubber between the seat pole and the clamp still way to big .. I cant even deal with it .. im just going to get another one ..
customer_reviews.author: S. Aversano

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sturdy rack with one minor glitch
customer_reviews.text: This a very well made product. It comes with everything needed to fit just about any bike. Instructions were fairly easy to follow. The most challenging part is working the clamp around the gear shifting cable. Depending on the position of your cable this might interfere to a degree. It didn’t affect my wife’s bike but on my Mongoose bike the cable runs along the side close to the bottom of the bar. The clamp moved the cable a fraction which now interferes with the last gear. I will probably need to find a way to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but a bugger to install.
customer_reviews.text: This cargo rack works well, but it is a bugger to instal. The directions could definitely be clearer, but the main problem was that I could see what needed to be done, but it was just physically difficult to accomplish. It took about an hour to fully instal this rack. I've used it several times and it is sturdy and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Vick1LTop Contributor: Yoga

customer_reviews.title: The price is right and this rack is very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I was estactic to find this rack at such a great price. The rack my touring bike wanted me to use was close to $200 and I wasn't ready for that commitment. This rack held up on a 350+ mile ride with at least 20 lbs on it. (I did make sure all the bolts were tight every 100 miles or so, as I did with the bike itself) I have a Salsa El Mariachi with 29in tires and was able to make this easily fit the bike for my needs. It is still on my bike, but from what I can tell no damage was done to the frame from this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy. Great rear bike rack. Sturdy and can hold a lot of weight
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rear bike rack. It’s very sturdy — I have a crate on top of it with my 30lb dog inside the crate and the rack easily holds both firmly. I did attach the crate to the rack with zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: tiffinis | 66d

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up so far!
customer_reviews.text: My first rear bike rack install for my daughters bike and it was very straightforward. I wish the side arms wouldve reached a little further as our bike actually had pre-drilled holes by the wheel hubs. Definitely use the included rubber inserts for spacing and helps with grip to the frame. This rack is surprisingly light and strong although I would hesitate to put 100lbs on there.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: It fits an xs bike.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third rack I purchased for this bike. Nothing would fit. The bike was an extra small size. With the adjustable arms I was able to fit it the the bike. I loaded it up and took a ride because I was afraid the screws would not hold it tight. I am happy to report that it works great with no worries. If I do have some advice - I would put the reflector on before you mount the rack instead of after. I couldn't get it on once the rack was mounted.
customer_reviews.author: rosemarie t frisone

customer_reviews.title: It's Behind Me!
customer_reviews.text: This rack was a snap to install. It's very sturdy. It's stylish too and gets the job done, perfectly. I installed it today and headed out to Home Depot & Shoprite for a few things. I put my items in a medium-sized canvas bag and used the convenient cargo net that came with the rack to secure it. Like I said, it gets the job done perfectly. And for the price, you cannot beat it! Jeffrey Hopkins Build a Better Mousetrap and the World Will Pave a Path to Your Door!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for the price!
customer_reviews.text: A very sturdy bike rack with leg supports. Great idea since most rack break at the seat post weld. The rack slides to the rear for larger loads. The instructions need to be rewritten. You cannot add the reflector after moving the rack to the rear. Throw away the wrench they include. It is just a cheap piece of metal that strips if you apply too much force. A great Rack for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Perna

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: My husband now looks like a respectable nerd. He purchased this bike rack so he can attach a bin to carry items he picks up from the store on short bike trips. The description says it will hold up to 115 pounds and it appears sturdy enough to do so. My husband is happy with it and that's what matters.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy's Tropical Garden

customer_reviews.title: Stury and esay install !
customer_reviews.text: Never being at ease with tools, i was surprised at how easy this was to assemble ! I recently bought a second-hand Mountain bike to ride on a nearby bike path and needed a way to bring along a few things without wearing a backpack so i decided to buy this rack . Couldn't be happier, very sturdy and it's exactly what i needed !
customer_reviews.author: zeePig

customer_reviews.title: Works on newer full suspension bikes
customer_reviews.text: This works on full Suspensions bikes (see photos). Had to take out the middle bolt under the rack so it wouldn’t hit the tire when going over bumps. I’ve carried approximately 20lbs for 40 miles on loose gravel, hard packed, dirt trail. Hanging saddle sometimes curls in and hits against spokes. I’ll have to use the netting to pull the flap outward to not hit. All in all great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Its okay overall.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to install on my Schwin adult bike. As to how much load it can carry I still have to find out and give an update later. Shopping of this item was slow. A little pricey for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shutter Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Looks well made and was easy to install. Did not add much weight to my bike. Using in a beach climate so time will tell how it holds up. I know the frame is aluminum but not sure about the screws and connectors so should not take long to see the overall quality. Happy so far- also feels like it would hold more weight than I would ever put on it. Quick release is a bit of a misnomer though.
customer_reviews.author: charles beasley

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack, Incoherent Assembly Instructions
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is sturdy and the parts (Bolts, tie downs, etc.) seem to be of quality material. But the assembly instructions were written by someone with only a rudimentary knowledge of English grammar. Very hard to follow, even with the pictures. Ended up ignoring them and just putting it together from the "finished" picture at the end of the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hand

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price and fairly easy to mount on my bike
customer_reviews.text: Over all a quality item. Reasonable price and fairly easy to mount on my bike. The only negative is the support arms for the rear forks could be a little longer. I had to extend them to the maximum to adjust it as I wanted too. That being said, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Great appearance and construction
customer_reviews.text: This rack is a delight! I learned about it when I installed one on my neighbor’s bicycle. A rack from Target holds 25 pounds; the Dirza holds 115 lbs! Quality and appearance are great. It installs with just the wrenches provided; nothing else needed. (Except for patience figuring out the directions, which are okay but not great). But I was able to puzzle it out in time and very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David Orlich

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy metal snapped in half
customer_reviews.text: After four months of moderate use one of the main metal support bars snapped in half. I had approximately 10 pounds of gear strapped to the rack and it broke when I hit a pot hole. I would not recommend this rack. UPDATE: The seller saw my review and immediately shipped me a new rack. I have changed my review from 1 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sean currens

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy rack. I love the net that comes with it. It easily secures my gear. I notice my leg does hit the locking mechanism as I am peddling, but only if I'm not mindful of it. They warn you that you need at least two inches on your seat height in order to prevent this, but I'm on the short side at 5'3. Us shorties are used to making adjustments, it really is not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: April Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done. Not the Best.
customer_reviews.text: Mayeb it's just me but this rack was hard to install. It's not very sturdy and the placement of the latch is not ideal. I had to tape it down because it was opened by my leg while riding. It does the job though for now though. I have had groceries on it a few times. No issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Product came with great directions and all the tools I needed to install it.
customer_reviews.text: My old bike rack was obsolete and didn't fit my new bike. I wanted a bike rack that mounted to the frame easily. This product worked perfectly and arrived with good directions and all the supplies to install it on my own. It was very easy to install and it is very sturdy yet lightweight. The only reason I gave this review 4 stars instead of 5 is because I had to loosen the entire rack in order to slide the rack back in toward the seat in order to install the rear reflector, the last step in the procedure. I suggest the reflector be installed in step 2.
customer_reviews.author: Anne E

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Solid Rack
customer_reviews.text: I love having this on my bike. I use it all the time. Side note with the netting, if I'm not using it I usually leave the netting at home. I tried to secure it to the rack just to keep it there, and it ended up coming undone and getting caught in my gears.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: 115 pounds capacity my ass
customer_reviews.text: Sue's account - Mike's review Garbage -Weak/Poor welds at support rod connection points. How much does a thirty pack of high life weigh? I don't know, neither do the makers of this as that is the heaviest thing placed in a milk crate secured to this pos rack. Support point sheared off. Most times this carried just a my everyday backpack. Say once a week for less than a mile it would carry the beer or lite grocery shopping. Get a rack with multiple support points not this crapola. Bought in August - Failed the following April - disposable at best.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product- solid and easy to adjust to your bikes frame.
customer_reviews.text: Took about 20 minuets to instant, adjustments were easy. I put it on my 2019 Trek Marlin 5- fit great! Strong construction and seems like you can carry whatever you want. Used it for two rides on rough back woods trails- very happy with it. I may get another one for my hybrid bike.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Budget alternative to the premium
customer_reviews.text: Setup: It takes about 30 minutes. Also note that It doesn't fit every bike perfectly. Specifically, the bottom rods that are fixed to the seat stays on the bike frame do not feel too sturdy. Quality: After a few months of riding in the rain, the main rack has kept its original form. The screws have started to rust, but that is less important. Usage: I have put my packed commuter bag of 20-25 pounds without any issue thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Could use larger side supports
customer_reviews.text: Good mounting system and hardware. This is very sturdy once installed. My only complaint is the the side pieces (the "W"-shaped pieces on each side) could be bigger. My saddle bags occasionally contact the wheel spokes, which is a very bad thing. If the side pieces were bigger, that would not happen.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but it is not heavy duty or meant for a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.text: I literally ordered this so I have something to put my Fairdale skate rack on so I can ride my bike to the skate park. So far so good. I have only had it a few days but it seems good for what I got it for. With that being said it doesn't seem super durable by any means. I would maybe put a light bag or something else thats light on it. The plus side is it is easy to put on and remove and isn't permanent nor do you need to modify your bike in anyway to install it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good rack but one issue
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good rack. Install was a bit finicky but not hard and the rack felt sturdy once completed. The main issue is the seat post quick release. It’s a bit too wide and i found that it rubbed slightly on the inner thigh. This was a road bike set up, so might be different on other bikes
customer_reviews.author: R. Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Love this luggage carrier and was easy too install and adjust too the bike
customer_reviews.text: Such a solid luggage carrier. Love the cargo net that came with it but above all the fact that it was adjustable to go farther back for room was the icing on the cake. This was the third one I bought and tried and I’m happy this one was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I received this rack in a timely manner and immediately installed on my Diamond Back "Diamond Rock" bike. The appearance and stuffiness of the rack exceeded expectations. Installation was intuitive and was also supported by color, photo instructions. So far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-point between ease of installation and adaptability for different bikes.
customer_reviews.text: Versatile enough. I put this on a mountain bike with wide tires and was able to adjust it to fit just fine. I was able to use only the tools that they provided. It takes a small amount of mechanical inclination to sort out what you need to do for some of the installation, because not all bikes are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kizer

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of weight
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only installed the rack and it fit my bike perfectly and stays still when I push down on it. In the pictures they say it wont fit frames with that wavy kind of shape (they called it uncommon frame) and it definitely will so they are selling themselves short. The product is pretty much completely metal but has a very interesting way of tightening the bolts that took a while to figure out. Not sure how it will hold up after a while but it seems to hold a lot of weight and fit's pretty much any bike.
customer_reviews.author: kelly hitt

customer_reviews.title: Simple mounting, tough little rack!
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack has great universal mounting brackets. The rack has protective rubber sheathing that will keep your paint from scuffing while installed should you choose to remove it sometime but I don't know why you would. I used this rack to haul a tool box over to my neighbor's house to fix a tractor and it held the 30# of tools and box like a champ for the 2 mile ride. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah McMillan

customer_reviews.title: good not great
customer_reviews.text: components are kinda crude, i had to file some of them myself, some screws are too long, aluminum alloy is too soft, not robust at all, not hard to install, nor easy, generally good, not great, i wanna give a 3.5 star

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Thus rack is light and strong. Exactly what I was looking for. Installation was a bit of a hassle because the clamp for the seat post is too big around and has to be shimmed with a scrap of innertube, but once everything is set up it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Discomfort with seats closer to frame.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this for anyone who's seat is close to the frame as the notch you use to attach the rack to the seat will hit your thighs constantly and make for a unpleasant ride. I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bobella

customer_reviews.title: WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but rattles a little louder than I thought it would. I like it weight tested and held up well, carry my bowling ball and backpack on it. Took a long ride, the other day and packed a whole picnic on it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar D. Vasquezgiron

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, solid and easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: I have these on 2 of my fat-boy bikes. These get a lot of use. They are solid and very flexible in application. I also tow a Rambo off-road bike trailer with them. I will buy more off these as I need them
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Meets my need...
customer_reviews.text: Fits my hybrid cross over perfectly. About 20-30 minutes to install. Bought this to carry a fishing pole and small gear bag. Attached a pole holder to one side and the gear bag is held on by the cargo web.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to my bike
customer_reviews.text: I'm really glad I got this. It was easy to install, is sturdy, and looks good on my bike. The best part about having this is that I can put my backpack on it so I don't have to wear it on my back while I commute to work. Makes the commute itself so much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: It broke after THREE WEEKS of use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update(09202019): Tina from Dirza sent us a replacement this week. The customer service is pretty good. Give the thumbs up! Iris C. Original review: We bought this earlier this year and mounted it in August for our son to put his wheeled backpack on the bike for his daily 6th grade commute. Initially it’s great and he loved it. His backpack is heavy, maybe 20 lb or so, and the 15-minute route is a little bumpy. But we never expect it fails just after 3 weeks into the semester!!! Apparently the connection between support bar and platform has serious quality problem. At least the one we bought has. You can see the pictures of the failed rack components. Disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Iris C.

customer_reviews.title: In the strongest possible terms I would not recommend buying these
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, but from there this is a negative review for me. The first bike trip I took it on, one of the support arms broke off in the first 25 miles. The other support arm broke off in the last three miles of my trip. You can also see that the screws started rusting after just one weekend. After the trip I checked and my panniers only weighed 14 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna LaCombe

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your bike-accessory buck
customer_reviews.text: Awesome rack, perfect for the small-to-medium loads I typically haul with my bike. I appreciate the fact that it leaves the mounting-hardware holes on the rear-wheel end of my bike frame free - so that perhaps I could invest in a cargo trailer for the few occasions that I need to haul bulkier loads. (Something my old frame-mount rear rack didn't do.)
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Webb

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat tedious to install using the rubber pads in the lower ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a 26" hardtail frame to convert this bike over for bike packing/hunting. The frame of my bike does not have the eyelets to install a traditional rear rack so this rack fit the bill perfectly. Somewhat tedious to install using the rubber pads in the lower jaws on the seat stays, but overall I am very pleased with the product. I believe it will haul what I need. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is as sturdy a rack as you will find. I installed it easily and with a milk crate on top, hauled tons of groceries. Maybe not tons but I estimated one time 40#. It finally broke at the top where the right hand upright support rod attaches to the underside of the rack. I moved the uprights to the front pannier mounts and am cutting a $5.00 piece of aluminum angle I bought at Home Depot to reinforce the back end. It'll be stronger but a good buy if you need something to HAUL.
customer_reviews.author: man

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to check frame support diameters!
customer_reviews.text: The support rod attachment is too large for the Trek ALR disc 5. Had to make shims to allow the clamp to be tightened. Tons sent me a nice email via Amazon asking for feedback which is nice; however, there is no return email.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Harshman

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to install as they say
customer_reviews.text: The product is well built an sturdy and is what I expected for quality however the installation took a bit of intuitiveness to get correct. The very brief installation illustrations were a bit misleading
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kindzierski

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I liked this because it is much more sturdier that the other seat post racks which only hold about 20lbs. This has adjustable side support brackets and is very sturdy. Overall it took about 20 min. To install and was a very simple install. It appears that it would fit the majority of different bikes. I like it a lot and if it holds up would buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. I.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, and seems well-built. The installation instructions could be a little better. Google Dirza bike rack installation and it's much easier watching a video on YouTube. I recommend this rack.
customer_reviews.author: JFish

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with quality upon arrival. Sharp edges, will scratch bike.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp metal in tube connector will scratch bike. Not welded straight (tube hole mis-aligned). Deep dings in black casing exposing interior metal. A few sharp metal pieces sticking through. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Watch the YouTube video before installing
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of following the enclosed directions rather than watching the YouTube video first. The writtend directions should be correct. However, the directions included with the rack were incomplete and difficult to follow. Also, the screw bent were I attached the rack to the stem of the bike seat. It is too late to send back because it is installed and I hope that it still continues to work for an extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Challenging to install, but very secure.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little challenging to follow, but once I figured it out, the installation was easy and the rack is very secure. I'd feel comfortable even with a light child (under 100 pounds) riding on it (though I don't recommend this). One problem: No easy way to attach a light on the back of it (since lights are designed to go on a round post).
customer_reviews.author: Scot A. Shier

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe with it is that there is no quick release on the arms as there is on the bike seat. It would make it so much fast to take it off and put it on. I end up just leaving it on.
customer_reviews.author: A River Town Dock Man

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: It came on time. It wasn't very hard to install and seems to be holding up well. My wife is using it on her bike to carry her camera and lenses so she must be pretty confident of it.
customer_reviews.author: backpack1953

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike rack. Hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.text: Major pain to install on my bike partly the rack partly the bike having disc brakes. To test the weight claim I sat on it and it didn't even make a sound. I need bags for it now so have not gotten any use from it yet.
customer_reviews.author: macgyver46

customer_reviews.title: I know they said it cannot go on a folding bike . . .
customer_reviews.text: but they were wrong! Here's a picture of it on a Zizzo--it is amazing at carrying heavy loads of groceries (providing you buy bungees if you are using a milk crate.) Would recommend in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

product_meta.title: Dirza Rear Bike Rack Bicycle Cargo Rack Quick Release Adjustable Alloy Bicycle Carrier 115 lbs Capacity Easy to Install Black
feature_bullets: STURDY:This bike carrier rack is made of durable aluminum alloy,strong and well built bike rack for carrying lots of weight.
QUICK RELEASE:Quick release mount at seat post.Easy to install and come with tools and installation instruction.
LARGE LOAD:This carrier rack is made of quality aluminum alloy,lightweight,but carries up to 115 lbs

W-SHAPED & ADJUSTABLE DESIGN:Design with W-shaped bars to prevent pannier from hitting the tires,keeps your pannier safe.The adjustable shelf and bottom rods,fits 18"-27.5" mountain bike type and road bike type.

NOTE:Does NOT fit Suspension bike,Fat tire bike, Women's cruiser bike,Bike seat,ect.The included nuts are locking nuts.When you installed the nut,The rubber inside the nut will prevent you from tightening. Just use a tool to tighten nut.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
